title: Bicycle Wrecks
name: Bicycle Wrecks
description:
A Map by Hive

Share your stories, tragic or funny.

properties.name: Being Doored by Coolidge Corner Saab Drivers ain't fun
properties.description: Posted by Justine  1300 Beacon Street, Brookline, MAZooming downhill along Beacon Street on my then almost new Univega hybrid (it had a black and red spider web paint design, very cool in 1991), a woman in a white Saab opened her door just as I was about to pass. I flew over the door; my bike didn\'t. I ended up sprawled in the middle of Beacon Street, cars approaching. My bike was twisted and mangled under the door. I jumped up to avoid being run over, blood dribbling down my arm and legs, and fetched my bike from under the car. The woman, slightly more than middle-aged sporting a fresh haircut and manicure, was red-faced and muttering as she examined the rubber edge around the door. She turned to me and started yelling that the Saab is new, that the door won\'t properly close now (even though she hadn\'t yet tried to close it), and that I should have been paying better attention. Stunned, I walked away, half-carrying my bike that was now too wrecked to ride.

properties.name: Bicycle Accident Investigation
properties.description: Posted by Hive702 South 1st Street, San Jose, CA, 95113Bicycle Accident Investigation 408-294-2412

properties.name: Bike Accident When I was 9
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 107 s citrus ave, los angeles, caI was riding around the block on my pink Diamond Back bmx when a car zooming out of a driveway backed into me, sending me careening into another car that was reversing out of the driveway next to it. I was thrown to the ground and bounced a few feet but found myself without a scratch. My bicycle was pinned under the second car. It seemed that the two old men involved were on their way to play some golf together and had been in a hurry. They were pretty freaked out about it and after making sure I wasn\'t hurt, pried my bike out for me. It was in ok condition too. I was terrified and shaking, thinking that since I had been in a car crash that the men might "sue me." After shouting thanks for helping me retreive my bike, I sped off in fear that they might pursue me to try to find out who I was for their impending lawsuit.

properties.name: Causing a Commotion
properties.description: Posted by Justine  falmouth, maI was 14 years old and riding my sister\'s ten speed to the fourth day at my first real job - bagging groceries at Purity Supreme. I was listening to Madonna\'s "Who\'s That Girl?" album on my walkman and singing "Causing a Commotion" as I crossed a side street. I looked up and saw an olive green Dodge approaching and knew it was going to hit me and thought, well maybe I won\'t have to bag groceries today. Then I woke up on the other side of the street, face down in the sandy gutter. I stood up to fetch my bike from the middle of the street and attempted to get on it to ride to work, but the tires were bent and mangled. Then I touched my bloody face and decided I had to sit on the grass under a tree or I would pass out. People gathered around. An ambulance and fire truck came. I told everyone the driver had taken off after he hit me (turns out this wasn\'t true but I liked saying it was a "hit and run" - the driver, a 78 year old man named Gerhart Duda, was there and more upset than I was). In the emergency room at the Falmouth Hospital, they stitched my face and mouth in a few places. I was a wreck for weeks with unsightly hemorrhaging in my right eye, my faced bruised and swollen and scabbed - my sisters made me wear large sunglasses at the dinner table, claiming they couldn\'t eat while looking at me. But I felt fortunate because I was able to quit my job and got paid for the rest of the summer by insurance, got a new bike out of the deal, and couldn\'t go in the sun so I had an excuse to stay inside and read all day.

properties.name: Cut off by out of town driver, totalled bike.
properties.description: Posted by Hive Polk & Eddy, SF, CAZooming down Polk, this guy decides to take a left from the right lane in his rented minivan. Bike totalled, both wrists bent up pretty badly, insurance refused to pay for any physical therapy, but did get me a swanky new bike.

properties.name: Di-Ann doored by tourists in a taxi.
properties.description: Posted by Jason 2nd Ave around East Third St., ManhattanComing up behind a double parked cab, 2 women got in and closed the door, we ride past, the door flies open half way, right into di\'s handlebars, i don\'t know how she didn\'t get seriously injured, she just kinda jumped off the bike and barely stumbled. The taxi took off real quick (jerk).

properties.name: Financial District
properties.description: Posted by KansanincaliSan franciscoHippy chick bike messenger moving at a good clip. BMW driven by requisite yuppy bastard in suit pulls out of alley suddenly and bike messenger slams on brakes, flies over bars onto and over hood of BMW. Helmet leaves large, visible scratch in paint. Yuppy Bastard jumps out and begins to yell. Messenger walks back to bike, inspects it for damage, mounts up and flips the YB off, then rides away. Left him standing purple faced on sidewalk spurting and bellowing. She never said a word. I laughed at the YB and went home.

properties.name: Keg kicking bike jump of death
properties.description: Posted by Cedarorford  So, when you and your friends are kicking a keg, what\'s the best possible idea all of you could possibly get? Yes, that\'s right, build an enormous bike jump on your incredibly steep driveway. The ramp got higher and higher, and got to a point where no sane soul would even think about it, but there was one idiot soul there, and that idiot soul was me. I flew higher than any keg kicking urban bike jumper in history, and dearly paid the price with a massive endo\' the handlebars. Notice, Legacy Hospital is nearby in this pic, was a fun night there as they sewed the ear back on and set the wrist and shot me "you dumbass" looks. Surprisingly the party, while temporarily bummed, was still in full force, waiting for me when I got back at 4:00... with a cold beer and lots of love.

properties.name: Popped a wheelie, wheel came off, down onto the forks!
properties.description: Posted by Jason wasco st, portland, orI think someone tried to steal my bike earlier that day, but i had been riding around a lot, allllmost home (3 doors down), i pop up the driveway, i see my front wheel just drift away ahead of me, and in slow motion, i descend onto the forks, chest hits handle bars, arms buckle, wind knocked out, faceplant. I was just a kid, maybe 10ish.?

properties.name: Rode Smack Into the Back of a Parked Car
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing I didn\'t know what hit me....er, what I hitI was probably about 10. I was headed tto the Kwik Shop to get my mom something. Milk or cigarettes or something like that. It was a short ride. Our little neighborhood hardly gets any traffic. I was just slowly pedaling along and I somehow got very deep indeed into a daydream. I remember that I was also watching the pavement move beneath me, something I used to do a lot when I was a kid. All of this while riding my bike. I was worlds away. I was probably not even really inside my own body anymore, mechanically pedaling my daydream forward. Then, suddenly, I was sitting on the trunk of a parked car. I had been so deep in my thoughts that at first I thought that I had been hit by a moving car. When I realized that I had actually just ran into the back of a parked car and been tossed (fairly gently, I wasn\'t going very fast) onto the car\'s trunk, my first reaction was to look around and check if anyone had seen me do it. I felt exposed and embarassed. The bike was fine. I was fine, though it is always jarring to be yanked out of your own reality into "real" reality so violently. I felt oddly ashamed and didn\'t ever tell anyone about this accident until I was in my 20s.

properties.name: Taken Down in a Field Sprint
properties.description: Posted by DkietzerWe do a ride every friday, with a few casual sprints in between. Two guys touched wheels in front of me during the leadout, went down, and I proceeded to flip over them...nasty... Nothing broken, just some road rash - reopened road rash since this was the first time back on my bike since monday\'s crash...

properties.name: directly into the curb, over the handlebars
properties.description: Posted by Jason ne wasco st, portland, orjust somehow didn\'t even try to pull up the front wheel.

properties.name: fell off my bike riding along West Cliff
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman This is the approximate location where I flew off my bike going about 18mph. I heard a "kachunk" sound and then I was over the handlebars and in the pavement. Luckily, a white Honda Civic driving behind me was able to stop before mowing me down! I had to go to the medical clinic to get my hip fixed up...the cut was so deep you could practically see bone. They couldn\'t do stitches because the cut was too wide, but they gave me burn ointment and a lot of gauze. I still have the scar....

properties.name: skidded eyeball, tooth and knuckles.
properties.description: Posted by Jason ne wasco near 19th, portland, orjumped a little grass patch up onto the sidewalk (driveway to driveway), landed all sideways, front wheel jacknifed, i went straight over to where my hands were still holding the grips, but now the bike and my own weight had them trapped against the pavement (skidding) and my face was the other point of contact with that sidewalk. my tooth lost some enamel, my eyeball itself was slightly scuffed and dirty, and the backs of my hands were all oozie and gnasty.
